DOC.HEAD: Sellout Crowds Expected to Jam Casino Showrooms for New Year's
DOC.TEXT: Comics Jay Leno and George Carlin and singers Wayne Newton and Dolly Parton are among the headliners who will do their numbers New Year's Eve for both high rollers and tourists at Nevada casinos. Even Tony Bennett will leave his heart and long-running singing engagement at the Fairmont Hotel in San Francisco for a one-night show Sunday in Las Vegas at the Riviera hotel-casino. ``We book way in advance to get the top headliners for the New Year's Eve show because people expect the biggest names,'' Dave Verbon, vice president of public relations at the Riviera, said Friday. ``All the casinos do it.'' Hotel-casinos also usually hold expensive parties for high rollers, which they refer to as VIPs, MVPs (most valuable players) or just ``good customers,'' who sometimes drop large amounts of cash and chips on gaming tables, said Brian Lawson, publicist for Bally's Reno. ``We put on a special New Year's Eve banquet that's a black-tie affair for our MVPs and they have their choice of shows afterwards,'' Lawson said. The special one-night show in Bally's Reno Grand Ballroom on Sunday night is called ``Into the '90s Laughing with George Carlin and Special Guests.'' The room's 2,600 seats are sold out, Lawson said. Country singer Randy Travis is playing to a capacity crowd of 2,000 in Bally's Ziegfeld Theatre and there's a rock 'n' roll show for people who want to see the new year in with a blast from the past. Some 150,000 tourists are expected at Las Vegas during the three-day holiday weekend and more than 50,000 in the Reno-Sparks area in northern Nevada, according to tourism officials. Rock 'n' roll hall of famers Chuck Berry and Jerry Lee Lewis will play Bally's Celebrity Room in Las Vegas, while the casino's other rooms will feature nostalgic appearances by '60s chart-toppers the Four Tops and Frankie Valli and the Four Seasons. Newton, a Las Vegas fixture, is playing the Hilton, the Smothers Brothers will be bickering at the Desert Inn and the Pointer Sisters will be singing in the new year at Caesars in Las Vegas. Miss Parton will play New Year's Eve and New Year's Day shows at Caesars Tahoe on the south shore at Stateline, Louise Mandrell headlines at Harrah's Reno and Leno cracks jokes at Harrah's Tahoe hotel-casino.
